Directions
In small dry saucepan, toast hazelnuts over medium-high heat, until they just start to brown and become fragrant, about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat and immediately transfer to mortar and crush with pestle to form coarse powder. (Alternatively, use a spice grinder.)
Serious Eats / Vicky Wasik
Trim and discard ends of cucumbers. Cut each cucumber in half lengthwise and then into thin slices. Place sliced cucumbers in medium mixing bowl.
Using whisk or fork, thoroughly mix mustard oil and lime juice in small bowl and pour over cucumbers. Add toasted hazelnuts and pepper flakes. Stir to combine. Season to taste with salt. Serve immediately.
Serious Eats / Vicky Wasik
Special Equipment

Notes
While many mustard oils available both in specialty stores and online in the United States are labeled "For External Use Only," they can be used in this recipe. If you are concerned about the levels of erucic acid in commonly available mustard oils, you can purchase Yandilla mustard oil in stores or online. It contains a relatively lower amount of erucic acid and is thus approved by the FDA for human consumption.
